Detailed Description

Base class for the serializable pointer and reference class.

This is the base class for the serializable pointer and reference class. The class holds the proxy of the serializable and the id of the serializable.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

§ object_holder() [1/3]

oos::object_holder::object_holder ( bool  is_internal)
explicitprotected

Creates and empty base pointer.

Creates and empty base pointer. The boolean tells the class if the serializable is handled as a reference or an pointer. The difference is that the reference couldn't be deleted from the object_store and the pointer can.

Parameters
is_internalTrue if the pointer is used internal, which means it is used to describe an entity.

§ object_holder() [2/3]

oos::object_holder::object_holder ( const object_holder &  x)
protected

Copies from another object_holder

Parameters
xthe object_holder to copy from.

§ object_holder() [3/3]

oos::object_holder::object_holder ( bool  is_internal,
object_proxy *  op 
)
protected

Creates an object_holder with a given object_proxy.

Creates an object_holder with a given object_proxy. The boolean tells the object_holder if it should be handled as an internal.

Parameters
is_internalIf true the serializable is handled as an internal.
opThe object_proxy of the object_holder

§ ~object_holder()

virtual oos::object_holder::~object_holder ( )
protectedvirtual

Destroys the object_holder and decides wether the underlaying object_proxy is destroyed as well.

It is destroyed if it is not inserted into any object_store.

§ is_internal()

bool oos::object_holder::is_internal ( ) const

Returns if this object_holder is inside of the object_store. This is important to calculate the reference and pointer counter.

Returns
True if the object_holder internal
